techmeme.title: Microsoft open sources the 14B-parameter AI model Phi-4 and its weights, available on Hugging Face under a MIT License, after releasing it in December 2024 (Carl Franzen/VentureBeat)
Audio: Meta told the International Fact-Checking Network that its US partnerships will end in March but Community Notes rollout is expected to take time (Pranav Dixit/Business Insider)
Internal 2023 docs: Meta exempted some top advertisers from its usual content moderation process amid concerns that its systems mistakenly penalised top brands (Financial Times)
EU rejects Zuckerberg's claim that "Europe has an ever increasing number of laws institutionalising censorship", saying it only requires illegal content removal (Philip Blenkinsop/Reuters)
JPMorgan files two lawsuits over its investment in fintech Viva Wallet; source: JPM claims €916M, alleging Viva deprived JPM the value of its 2022 investment (Sotiris Nikas/Bloomberg)
